title: Dame Helen Mirren puts on an animated display with Sir Ian McKellen at The Good Liar premiere
text:
They're starring in a film together for the first time.

And Dame Helen Mirren was in great spirits as she joined Sir Ian McKellen, 80, on the red carpet for the world premiere of their film The Good Liar in London on Monday.

The iconic actress, 74, looked elegant in a black gown, which had a semi-sheer polka-dot outer-layer that gave her look a glamorous flourish.

Having fun: Dame Helen Mirren looked elegant in a black polka-dot gown as she put on an animated display with Sir Ian McKellen at the premiere for The Good Liar in London on Monday

Helen's ensemble had a chic bow across her neckline, and she completed the look by wearing sheer tights and black heels.

Ever the fashionista, Helen accessorised her outfit by wearing a pair of diamond earrings and a designer watch.

The Catherine The Great star wore her ivory locks in a sleek, straight style, and used a natural palette of make-up to highlight her pretty features.

In the drama, directed by Bill Condon, Sir Ian plays a con artist trying to outwit well-to-do widow Betty McLeish (Helen) who is looking for love, however things take an unexpected turn as the pair play a dangerous game of cat and mouse.

Dame Helen and Sir Ian put on a very animated display on the red carpet together, as the actor took his co-star's hand and danced while posing for photos.

The film marks the first time Helen and Ian have worked together on the big screen, while it is the fourth time Ian and director Bill have collaborated with one another, including his Oscar-nominated turn in Gods And Monsters.

The Good Liar will be released in cinemas across the UK on 8 November, and in the USA on 15 November.
